org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_aruco

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer
      • org.bytedeco.opencv.opencv_aruco.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CharucoBoard, GridBoard

    @Namespace(value="cv::aruco")
 @Properties(inherit=opencv_aruco.class)
public class Board
extends Pointer
    \brief Board of markers A board is a set of markers in the 3D space with a common coordinate system. The common form of a board of marker is a planar (2D) board, however any 3D layout can be used. A Board object is composed by: - The object points of the marker corners, i.e. their coordinates respect to the board system. - The dictionary which indicates the type of markers of the board - The identifier of all the markers in the board.

      IntPointer ids()
      vector of the identifiers of the markers in the board (same size than objPoints) The identifiers refers to the board dictionary
      Board ids(IntPointer setter) 
      Point3fVectorVector objPoints()
      array of object points of all the marker corners in the board each marker include its 4 corners in this order: - objPoints[i][0] - left-top point of i-th marker - objPoints[i][1] - right-top point of i-th marker - objPoints[i][2] - right-bottom point of i-th marker - objPoints[i][3] - left-bottom point of i-th marker Markers are placed in a certain order - row by row, left to right in every row.
      Board objPoints(Point3fVectorVector setter)

        \brief Provide way to create Board by passing necessary data. Specially needed in Python.
        Parameters:
        objPoints - array of object points of all the marker corners in the board
        dictionary - the dictionary of markers employed for this board
        ids - vector of the identifiers of the markers in the board

      • setIds

        public void setIds(@ByVal
                   Mat ids)
        \brief Set ids vector
        Parameters:
        ids - vector of the identifiers of the markers in the board (should be the same size as objPoints) Recommended way to set ids vector, which will fail if the size of ids does not match size of objPoints.

      • setIds

        public void setIds(@ByVal
                   UMat ids)

      • setIds

        public void setIds(@ByVal
                   GpuMat ids)

      • objPoints

        @ByRef
public Point3fVectorVector objPoints()
        array of object points of all the marker corners in the board each marker include its 4 corners in this order: - objPoints[i][0] - left-top point of i-th marker - objPoints[i][1] - right-top point of i-th marker - objPoints[i][2] - right-bottom point of i-th marker - objPoints[i][3] - left-bottom point of i-th marker Markers are placed in a certain order - row by row, left to right in every row. For M markers, the size is Mx4.

      • objPoints

        public Board objPoints(Point3fVectorVector setter)

      • dictionary

        @opencv_core.Ptr
public Dictionary dictionary()
        the dictionary of markers employed for this board

        @StdVector
public IntPointer ids()
        vector of the identifiers of the markers in the board (same size than objPoints) The identifiers refers to the board dictionary

public Point3f rightBottomBorder()
